description:
From the logs it appears that the host name is not being set correctly, resulting in the error:

NoMatch: Values do not match:
Template: fake-mini
Response: <name of host used to run the tests>

Strangely enough this only happens when running the tests individually or when running the integrated tests alone. It can easily be reproduced eg. by running:

./run_tests.sh nova.tests.integrated.test_api_samples.HypervisorsSampleJsonTests.test_hypervisors_uptime
title: Some nova.tests.integrated.test_api_samples.Hypervisors* tests fail when run as single test

comments.content:
From the logs it appears that the host name is not being set correctly, resulting in the error:

NoMatch: Values do not match:
Template: fake-mini
Response: <name of host used to run the tests>

Strangely enough this only happens when running the tests individually or when running the integrated tests alone. It can easily be reproduced eg. by running:

./run_tests.sh nova.tests.integrated.test_api_samples.HypervisorsSampleJsonTests.test_hypervisors_uptime
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hanlind

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master

commit 8b79ac24a83854de9f57bb3526a2edbd0b6d64d2
Author: Hans Lindgren <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed May 8 15:43:32 2013 +0200

    Make sure that hypervisor nodename is set correctly in FakeDriver
    
    This resolves an issue where the wrong host name is used when
    executing some sample_api tests individually.
    
    Resolves bug 1177802.
    
    Change-Id: I29af026e29ff8c70bb6b4c81f1bdf28cdea11140
